name: State_11

timeline_beats.label: Entrenchment as mercantile node; joins island mercantile networks
Great Naval War impacts fleet and borders
Integration under Open-Seas frameworks; joins Sea Trade Union

factions.label: Grand Merchant Houses
factions.influence_hint: Primary control of long-distance trade, port leases, and reagent imports

factions.label: Naval Directorate
factions.influence_hint: State navy and coastal defense; influential in border negotiations

factions.label: Guild of Navigational Augurs
factions.influence_hint: Controls ritual-seamanship services and augury workshops; gatekeepers of charts

factions.label: Fisher Clans & Dockworker Soviets
factions.influence_hint: Local labor power, control of fisheries and shore logistics

traits: practical literacy concentrated among merchants and augurs
patrilineal house affiliations with port-based patronage

constraints: No instant resurrection or true life-replacement magics
Long-range mind influence rare and institutionally banned
Navigational auguries cannot replace charts and seamanship
Combustion-derived industry limited; no high-pressure steam megatechs
Ritual magic consumes scarce imported reagents or specialized labor; logistics constraint on large-scale rituals
Must respect inter-state maritime treaties and recent boundary recalibrations
notes: State reliant on imported reagents and foreign trade for ritual systems and advanced ship repairs
Naval capability tied to cooperation between Merchant Houses and Naval Directorate
Maritime boundaries contested along northern shoals; border changes shape fishing rights
Guild control of augury services creates choke points for navigation and trade privileges
